alert.note: Alert for Livingston; Washtenaw (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 19 at 4:30AM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms affecting Livingston and Washtenaw Counties through 530 AM EDT... At 428 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles southeast of Williamston to Stockbridge to near Brooklyn. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds around 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Manchester and Gregory around 440 AM EDT. Fowlerville and Pinckney around 445 AM EDT. Howell and Chelsea around 450 AM EDT. Cohoctah and Oak Grove around 455 AM EDT. Dexter and Hamburg around 500 AM EDT. Ann Arbor, Hartland, Saline, Brighton and Whitmore Lake around 505 AM EDT. South Lyon around 510 AM EDT. Ypsilanti and Dixboro around 515 AM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Pittsfield Township, Whittaker, Plainfield, Hudson Mills Metropark, Island Lake State Recreation Area, Bridgewater, Delhi Mills, Pleasant Lake, Barton Hills and Conway Township. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
